text:
<@U5BGUA4BX> Hey We have added the .load function in but still not working. Here is the code. 

var containerEl = $( “#Container” );

var config = {
    animation: {
        enable: false
    },
    selectors: {
        target: ‘.item’
    },
    
};
var mixer = .mixItUp(containerEl, {
    controls: {
        live: true,
        toggleLogic: ‘and’
    },
    load: {
        filter: window.location.hash
        
    }
});
I believe it's available in the marketplace (free). But we've transitioned to using custom modules and it's actually worked out quite well.

for accuracy sake, JS files were also affected if they were edited within that timeframe.(atleast in the case of a DM2 Custom module’s JS). my instances of the problem were fixed. Thank you guys for working on a fix.

Is there anyone who could provide an update re: GDPR features? Specifically, our legal team is asking about Cookie opt-in, the feature is labeled as releasing in "Early April" on the product readiness page and has not been updated. Thank you!

I too would be interested in seeing the page get updated with current expected timelines

I also think it’d be helpful if it can be updated to state if any configuration by HS customers will be required in order to comply.

I am most urgent to see if there will be some ability for HS to control opt-in/opt-out for non-hubs cookies. Most of these services do not have clear steps for technical implementation of opt-in yet, and it would be a lifesaver.

HS can’t really offer that other than intentionally breaking the scripts.

You should seek information from the third party cookie/tracking companies about their products.

For example Google Analytics:
<https://privacy.google.com/businesses/compliance/#?modal_active=none>

<@U4F337UM8> you’ll need to apply some string cleaning to the window hash - in this case, window.location.hash returns the string “#Further-Education”, but looking at the data-filter, it’s “.further-education”. Again, it’s been a while away from Mixitup, but from my memory “.further-education” (not sure if you need the period) would be the string you want to pass into the config, so you’ll want to run a function that removes the “#” and lowercases the capital letters

Hey all, we were working on improving our CSP policy and were trying to find a running list of all the different domains HS loads scripts from to be more exclusive than inclusive; I don't suppose such a list exists?
Howdy! I have a question about the new way the Choice fields are integrated.
In the page editor, the new Choice field has an extra addition called "search"
How can I remove that option so that only the ones defined specifically are present?
True, that’s a good point. Doesn’t look like there is a way to remove it

hi, somebody here had worked creating a multi-step form, how you did it? i already read this: <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/forms/how-do-i-create-a-multi-step-form>  but it looks not great. Some help?
<http://school.insideinbound.com/courses/HubSpot-multi-page-form-course>
Free course by BrandBuilder. I haven't went through it, so not sure how accurate/up to date it is, but I came across it a couple months ago.
i made my own form markup and copied all the form values to a hidden HubSpot form
maybe more hassle than it's worth, but it's not too hard and is the only way to guarantee the form markup won't change and screw it up
<http://www-chargebackgurus-com.sandbox.hs-sites.com/cost-savings-analyzer>
using flickity <https://flickity.metafizzy.co/>

we did this using the API once, but the situation we had, we had to make the form change the available inputs based on prior inputs, (so it created like a decision tree), and at each step we sent HS the current data entered to prevent data loss if somoene abandoned
I didn’t personally work on it, a colleague did but it seemed kinda complicated. overall
:s
If you make the choice field required it will remove ‘Search’
related to forms, anyone know if there’s a way to “destroy” a HS form?
looks like you at least can via api: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/v2/delete_form>
ahh, that’s more extreme than I actually meant,
thanks though

I was actually meaning destroy as in once you call the embed code using javascript, I want to be able to kill the instance of it since HS forms use react. I need to render  multiple forms in the same place
and I originally wanted to render the form then kill it and pop in the new form if necessary.
The scope on the project changed though so max there will only be a few forms, where there was the potential to have close to 100 before
So I might just have them all be rendered and just toggle their display
ah, so remove it from the dom... I've never experimented with that
exactly
this isn't your vue project is it? could you conditionally render the form embed?
remove from DOM and kill any event listeners was my idea

I can conditionally render the form embed but if HS form has event listeners(which I’m sure it does because it uses react) those will stick around and could theoretically mess with another form load or cause memory issues
and yes it is the vue project
just gonna take the easy route, since now I know there will only be a handful of forms. Going to render them all and toggle their visual display. seems easiest

Yeah, only way I would think would be clean would be to use a dummy form that populates a vue data object, then on "submit" submits the right HS form with the values stored in data, if that makes any sense.
interesting idea. if I had more time I think I’d rather do it that way, would especially help if I still had to handle 100s of forms
That's my usual workflow when I "roll my own" forms on react projects, as it makes validation really easy; don't see why it wouldn't work in vue too.
crap, can’t really go the easy route due to some requirements of this app. ugh
Sorry man :confused: if you want some more help, feel free to DM me some code and I'll see if I can come up with an idea
yup it’s a free course. thanks Jeff for the heads up.  All I can say is take the course on the form and if it’s not helpful let me know and we’ll make it right.  Thanks for the share and follow Josh
